page.title: 10FARMING:WOODTON AREA
page.content: The 4 part-parishes in this block are farmed by about a dozen families.The land is similar in texture throughout; strong mixed soil,except for about 300 acres of much lighter soil in Woodton. The subsoil is sand,gravel & clay. The main crops grown are wheat,barley for malting & animal feed,rape & green peas for canning;a much lower acreage of sugar-beet & other roots is now grown,compared with the past. Livestock enterprises are declining, mainly owing to fewer dairy herds in the area,which in turn reduces the grass acreage.There are 1 or 2 pig enterprises,1 flock of sheep;beef cattle are fattened on most farms.On the mixed farms,straw is not usually burnt,but used for bedding down animals & on some farms is chopped & treated to feed both the dairy herd & beef cattle.
